bio.bio: Computer audiovisual composer. He started in the late 90's as a composer of electronic and concrete music. His work is deeply intertwined with algorithmic processes and concepts.
bio.bio2: In the mid-2000's, he began to explore programming languages ​​and apply algorithmic techniques in computer music and computer graphics, developing a series of experimental audiovisual pieces.
bio.bio3: His current work is attached to a number of -not only- computacional concepts such as generativity, noise, machines, fractals and algebraical processes; and some others meta-structural ones like modularity and hybridization in complex systems (digital-analog, man-machines, etc) and networks.  He is also interested in live-coding and improvisation.
bio.bio4: His works include musical compositions, electronic audiovisuals performances, installations, videoart and apps, among others.
bio.bio5: He is teacher and researcher at Rosario National University - UNR.
